Australia: Swan River Colony had its name changed to Western Australia.
Belgium:
Albert Joseph Goblet d'Alviella replaces Félix de Muelenaere as Prime Minister
Siege of Antwerp by Belgian army with French support forces Dutch from Antwerp Citadel.
Chile: Discovery of mineral deposits in Chañarcillo, and the beginning of the rise of silver in what was then el Norte Chico and now constitutes the Atacama and Coquimbo regions of Chile. The mining fortunes constitute an important source of power in the following decades.
Colombia:
José Ignacio de Márquez is President of the Republic of New Granada
Francisco de Paula Santander is President of the Republic of New Granada
Coat of Arms of Colombia is officially adopted
France: June Rebellion: Unsuccessful Anti-monarchist insurrection in Paris.
Germany: Goethe died. Wilhelm Busch was born. Hambach Festival: A rally began at Hambach Castle where participants demonstrated for the liberalization and unification of the German states.
Singapore: Singapore becomes the centre of government of the Straits Settlements.
Sweden: Completion of Göta Canal, providing route from Gothenburg (west coast) to Söderköping (east coast)
